title: Lagspikes after 6.9
body: Hello! I'm experiencing some sick lagspikes after 6.9 patch. My connection was always decent ( Eune , 60mbps download speed ) But when this patch came out it make the game unplayable for me. I'm getting lagspikes constantly (around 100-150 ms ).It works If I play on wired connection but in Wifi it sucks.. Riot what happened ? ( I'm already in touch with 1 Rioter IT guy but he didnt reply for a whole day so I guess he doesnt have any idea what is the problem. )

replies.body:
This definitely sucks and is not something we want you to have at all when trying to play League.  Keep in mind though that these issues do not seem related to the latest patch, even though there seems to be strong correlation.  Patches that we release may change how the game itself works, but it does not affect the connection your computer has to the individual game server.  This is not to say the problem is on your end, it may very well be on Riots, but we need to start eliminating root causes so we can find the culprit.

Before anything else, I need to talk about wifi connections -- they are inherently unstable and are ***not recommended*** to be used with League of Legends.  We can help you troubleshoot a little bit, but due to the nature of wifi the first step will always be to get off wifi if possible.  For the OP, since it works perfectly fine in wired, but not on wifi, the root cause does appear to be the wifi itself.

If there lag spikes persist consistently, make sure to complete all of the steps in our [Connection Issues Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664).  It should help to resolve these spikes and will also allow us to start eliminating the most common root causes so we can dig further.

Let me know if you are still experiencing issues!

Maybe the servers have some issue?? because me, and almost all lol palyers i know experinced the same problem, good internet, but the MS wont go lower then 100. Too much of a coincidence. Also the forum is full of people complaining about lagg after 6.9....

There are indeed times when individual game servers do have issues that affect all players in the game.  However, these are incredibly rare, and if you experience issues game to game, it is very unlikely to be a fault of the game servers. This is why we want to eliminate as many root causes as possible!

Also, I would caution using the argument that people posting in Help and Support indicate a larger issue.  Consider walking into a doctor's office.  Everyone in the waiting room is sick, but just because the waiting room (like Help and Support) is full of sick people, does not mean everyone or the majority of the population is sick.  We want to take these issues on one at a time and get these resolved ASAP!

Hmmm...have you had a chance to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) over to us yet?  One of our Tech Specialists can combine forces with you and help figure out where the root cause is.  Just make sure to provide the following information in your ticket:

1) [Network Analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1)

2) [Network Information Log](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4)

3) [Process List](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3)

Thanks for the quick response. In case it matters, i just clicked REPAIR in the patcher, you know, the first thing anyone would do before looking for other solutions, and it worked, my ping wont go higher then 30 as it used to be so...... TECHNOLOGY YES!!

I have this same problem. Been trying to get help on this forum for an entire week. I've about given up, which must be Riot's desire. So many people have said they've been playing for years with no connectivity issues until patch 6.9 but nothing is being done to fix it. I can't play ranked at all and even normal aren't enjoyable because of these horrible, crippling lag spikes. They are not on my end, at all. I've run internet speed tests, flushed dns / followed troubleshooting, and no other web service (including streaming) or other video games (overwatch, magic online, dota 2) are affected by ANY LAG WHATSOEVER. My ping in game is always 60-70 but occasionally it spikes to 300-5,000 ms. 

I am in dire need of help, but i'm feeling so apathetic because I doubt it will come.
Yeah, before patch 6.9 everything was just fine, now I can only use wire to play the game instead of wifi which is super inconvenient.

I'm having packet loss instead of crippling ping spikes, but same deal.

Weirdly, mine always seems to go away after a while.  Unfortunately, "a while" has recently changed from "a few minutes" to "about 20 minutes", and dropping packets for 15-20 minutes is not a fun or worthwhile use of my time.

edit:  Worth noting that I am not using wireless, it doesn't work on a wired connection for me, so maybe not the same deal.  (Wifi is always unreliable to some extent.)
